instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2016 Running Slow
threads.message:
Hi !

I hate to work on this board, no fan spin = no fun. The board was liquid damaged, came here with no image. I refurbished the LCD connector that had minor corrosion and replaced the flex, LCD came back. When LCD went back, I discovered there was no KB no TP, the TP flex was damaged so I changed it too and now I have KB and TP, access to session and battery detection & charging.

The last problem is that the Mac is running really slow, I ultrasonic cleaned the board, no change. I tried with another battery and an other LCD, same thing. I found that <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is a bit higher as expected at 8.75V and it's probably a clue but I don't know how to interpret this.

Thank you for you help and ask me anything that I forgot on this description.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2016 Running Slow
threads.message: Run HWMonitor and see if reports any strange value.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2016 Running Slow
threads.message: The only thing strange is the "Heatpipe outgoing Air" sensor, which is fun because there is no heatpipe on these...the temp is 128Â°C. Also it shows me 0.00V on something called "Mainboard S0 Rail", I don't think it makes sense, the Mac wouldn't run if it was the case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2016 Running Slow
threads.message:
Heatpipe temp is irrelevant; I saw it in older machines and doesn't affect.
Should still be corrosion somewhere on the board.
Try to start in diagnostic mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2016 Running Slow
threads.message: Good call diag mode. I have 2 error codes, PFM006 related to the SMC and PPN001 related to the power management. I don't have any SMC for this board to try right now, but if there is crap under the SMC maybe a reballing would be enough. Before, do you have a good board like this to compare some values on SMC and Power IC in diode mode ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2016 Running Slow
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2016 Running Slow
threads.message: Change the trackpad, or test with known good one...
